content.description: This is on private property. We didn't realize it was when we went up here. It is best to leave it alone until we know climbers are welcome to climb here.
content.protection: A standard rack up to BD #3s.
content.location: This is on the right side of the Crypto Wall. The black corner on the upper portion of the first pitch is obvious.

content.description:
This is Hudak's first climb ever!

Stem and/or chimney the unusual, mica-laden rock leading to a flared splitter and OW pod. This route will expand your geologic horizons....

Hidden jugs keep the climbing moderate until you reach the upper OW. Thrutch up through pegmatite and mica until you can pull over a small roof to belay. You'll either be nostalgic for the Black Canyon or reminded why you don't like climbing there....

Follow the best looking option on the second pitch or walk off to the right. We walked off but recommend climbing up to the top before walking right.

This may be on private property.
content.protection: A standard rack up to a BD #4. The upper section still needs some brushing.
content.location:
This is immediately left of

Salem

. Most parties will opt to scramble up 10 feet to a ledge to rope up.

content.description:
The first pitch is mostly good hands to some OW and back in to good hands and fun climbing. It lasts about 100 feet. It is well-protected and awesome climbing to a fat belay ledge.

The second pitch continues from fat ledge through the roof, easy climbing after pulling through the roof, and a walk off to the right.
content.protection: 0.3-#5 Camalots with a set of nuts. There is a tree to belay off of at the top of the second pitch.
content.location: The route follows a fairly obvious line up the middle of the buttress through a roof at the top. Start on a solid flake with good hands.
